bill.title: Body-Worn Cameras; Vehicle Cameras; County Police Departments; Appropriation ($)
bill.description: Establishes requirements, restrictions, and implementation timelines for body-worn cameras and vehicle cameras for county police departments. Appropriates funds to the Attorney General to distribute to each county for the purchase of body-worn and vehicle video cameras subject to dollar-for-dollar match by the county. Requires each county receiving funds to report to the Legislature. (SB2411 HD2)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Introduced.

Referred to PSM/JDL, WAM.
Re-Referred to PSM, JDL/WAM.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-09-16 2:00PM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on PSM deferred the measure until 02-16-16 1:35PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Espero, Baker, Inouye, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2440) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL/WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL/WAM.
The committee(s) on JDL/WAM will hold a public decision making on 02-24-16 10:00AM in conference room 211.
The committee(s) on JDL/WAM deferred the measure until 03-01-16 10:30AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, K.Kahele, L. Thielen, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard, Kim.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 8 Aye(s): Senator(s) Tokuda, Dela Cruz, Chun Oakland, Harimoto, Inouye, Riviere, Wakai, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) English, Galuteria, Taniguchi.
Reported from JDL/WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2710) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 03-08-16.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Ihara . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Riviere). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 161) in amended form (SD 2).
Pass First Reading

Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Woodson; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) McDermott, Thielen; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Rhoads, Kawakami, C. Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-28-16 3:00PM in conference room 312.

The conference committee deferred the measure.
